David,

You don't understand I need projects like these to
keep me busy. "Idle hands are the devils work" or
however the saying goes. The wood costs me nothing as
most often I pull it out of the scrap bin (you'd be
amazed what people will throw away) and the time it
takes me to build one well that's just wasted time
between when I get off work and when the wifey gets
home. Besides I need a reason to get off my butt and
get back into the woodshop. I have so many projects on
the back burner but no real motivation to go and get
started on them. So if any of you out there would be
interested in a custom box just get a photo copy of a
Tsuba you want it for and mail it to me. I ask for a
photo copy and not a digital picture because I need a
1:1 copy to work from. I'm not going to ask anything
but shipping for the box's at least for now because
there is no timetable for completion of them. When I
start doing them to turn a profit THEN I'll start
charging for labor. But for right now I just want to
use my woodworking skills before I lose them.

Bob R

P.S. Tsuba bags are easy just get yourself some
pliable felt cut it about an 8th of an inch wider than
the Tsuba on either side and 3 times the length. Fold
the tsuba up with the felt and sew up two sides. This
should give you a flap that you can either sew velcro
onto it or get some silk string to tie the bag shut.
